tasks.description: Three genders educational diagram. Three columns with color coding: Column 1 (blue) = MASKULIN / der (Tisch, Stuhl), Column 2 (red) = FEMININ / die (Lampe, Tür), Column 3 (green) = NEUTRAL / das (Bett, Sofa, Fenster). Include warning symbol with text: 'Gender is grammatical, NOT biological! Example: das Mädchen (neuter) = girl'. Use icons or simple furniture illustrations.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Three grammatical genders in German (der/die/das system)

specs.style: educational diagram, three-column layout, color-coded, clear visual distinction, warning callout

tasks.notes: CRITICAL concept - foundation of German noun system. Must be extremely clear.

tasks.description: Gender learning patterns infographic. Three sections showing common patterns: 1) DER patterns: days (Montag), months (Januar), seasons (Sommer) with calendar icons. 2) DIE patterns: numbers (die Eins), words ending -ung/-heit/-keit with examples. 3) DAS patterns: words ending -chen/-lein (Mädchen, Fräulein), letters of alphabet (das A). Use icons and visual mnemonics. Include large text: 'ALWAYS learn nouns WITH their article!'
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Patterns and rules for predicting gender - learning strategies

specs.style: educational infographic, pattern recognition, visual mnemonics, memorable icons, study tips

tasks.notes: Practical learning tool - helps students predict and memorize genders
